user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtAssertEx:
```c
bool UtAssertEx(bool Expression, UtAssert_CaseType_t CaseType, const char *File, uint32 Line, const char *MessageFormat,
                ...)
{
    va_list va;
    char    FinalMessage[256];
    uint32  TestSegmentCount;
    uint32  TotalTestCases;

    UT_BSP_Lock();

    ++UT_SegmentCounters.TotalTestCases;

    if (Expression)
    {
        CaseType = UTASSERT_CASETYPE_PASS;
    }

    if ((uint32)CaseType < UTASSERT_CASETYPE_MAX)
    {
        ++UT_SegmentCounters.CaseCount[(uint32)CaseType];
    }

    TestSegmentCount = 1 + UT_TotalCounters.TestSegmentCount;
    TotalTestCases   = UT_SegmentCounters.TotalTestCases;

    UT_BSP_Unlock();

    va_start(va, MessageFormat);
    vsnprintf(FinalMessage, sizeof(FinalMessage), MessageFormat, va);
    va_end(va);

    UtAssert_DoReport(File, Line, TestSegmentCount, TotalTestCases, CaseType, CurrentSegment, FinalMessage);

    return Expression;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags: UtAssert_DoReport(File, Line, TestSegmentCount, TotalTestCases, CaseType, CurrentSegment, FinalMessage);
explanation: Other fragments in the snippet do not need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13: the pointer parameters in the function prototype (File and MessageFormat) are already const-qualified; there are no other pointer declarations in this function body (va_list is an implementation-defined type for varargs handling, not a pointer-to-object declaration subject to this rule); and the remaining statements (locks, counter increments, simple scalar assignments) do not declare or pass non-const pointers. No other pointer targets appear within the provided snippet that would be candidates for const-qualification based on the available code.
